summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York and a court clerk regarding the submission of a signed application/affidavit and its exhibits related to the Epstein case. The correspondence confirms the receipt and filing of these legal documents.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The prosecutor from the Southern District of New York is corresponding with a court clerk to ensure the signed affidavit and its exhibits are properly filed in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Arraignment Unit Clerk
persons.context: The clerk at the United States District Court in New York is handling the receipt and filing of the signed affidavit and exhibits related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding the filing of legal documents (signed affidavit and exhibits) in the Epstein case.

events.title: Filing of Epstein affidavit and exhibits
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney submits a signed affidavit and its exhibits to the court clerk for filing in the Epstein case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
United States District Court, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from October 2020 regarding the Epstein case.
An Assistant United States Attorney is submitting a signed affidavit and exhibits to the court for filing.
The correspondence highlights procedural steps in maintaining the court's file with proper documentation.
The email chain includes a caution about external emails, indicating sensitivity.
The document references multiple file identifiers (EFTA00018402, EFTA00018403, EFTA00018404) suggesting it is part of a larger set of records.
